translation.en: [female officer] Can you tell me your full name? Yasmin Sundermeyer.
translation.es: - ¿Me dices tu nombre completo? - Yasmin Sundermeyer.

translation.en: [female officer] This is the first time you're arrested for a felony charge,
translation.es: Es la primera vez que te arrestan por un delito grave,

translation.en: so I have to get your DNA.
It's just a mouth swab and a few fingerprints. Okay?
translation.es: Solo un hisopado de saliva y huellas dactilares. ¿Sí?

translation.en: Stand right here on the white X.
translation.es: Párate aquí en la X blanca.

translation.en: Face the screen.
Do your left hand first.
So, young lady...
you seriously did...
or allegedly did all this stuff in those house shoes right there?
translation.es: ...o supuestamente hizo todo esto con esas pantuflas?

translation.en: Now they're all dirty.
[male office] Have you been here before? Any jail?
No?
Did you flee? Did you run?
Got up to, like, 130.
I got away, but then I got caught.
translation.es: Me escapé, pero luego me atraparon.

translation.en: So you really didn't get away, did you now?
Open up your mouth.
So, you know what's going to happen, right? The process?
translation.es: ¿Sabe qué va a pasar, no? ¿El proceso?

translation.en: You have the right to bail. What's your bail?
translation.es: Tiene derecho a la libertad bajo fianza. ¿Cuánto es?

translation.en: Hundred thousand dollars.
Someone can bail you out.
Otherwise, you're gonna see a judge on Tuesday.
translation.es: Si no, verá a un juez el martes.

translation.en: So... you'll get arraigned,
you'll enter your plea,
and then go from there.
translation.es: y a partir de ahí se verá.

translation.en: Questions, comments, concerns?
All right.
Best of luck to you.
Head all the way down to your left.
You can use the phone in there.
You can call any of the bail bondsman's numbers
translation.es: Puedes llamar a cualquier fiador judicial

translation.en: or any of your family members or friends.
translation.es: o a cualquier familiar o amigo.

translation.en: [woman shouts] Hello?
Hello? Hello?
[woman] Oh, my fucking God!
What are you doing?
Being in here in jail, it'll break you.
translation.es: Estar en la cárcel te destruye.

translation.en: Nobody in their right mind wants to be sitting
translation.es: Nadie en su sano juicio quiere estar sentado

translation.en: in a cell like this, caged up.
And this place is clearly crazy.
translation.es: Este lugar sin duda es una locura.

translation.en: [female officer] At the Sacramento County Main Jail,
translation.es: En la Cárcel Principal del Condado de Sacramento,

translation.en: there are over 2,400 male and female inmates.
translation.es: hay más de 2400 reclusos y reclusas.

translation.en: Jail is like a small town, but not like a normal small town.
translation.es: La cárcel es como una pequeña ciudad, pero no una ciudad normal.

translation.en: You gotta pick up on a whole new set of rules.
translation.es: Debes aprender una serie de reglas nuevas.

translation.en: Everyone is in everybody's business
because our lives are really right on top of each other.
translation.es: porque vivimos una encima de la otra.

translation.en: There's no privacy in jail. We're women, we get periods.
translation.es: No hay privacidad aquí. Somos mujeres, menstruamos.

translation.en: You know? We all gotta use the restroom, all that, you gotta get used to that.
translation.es: Todas tenemos que usar el baño, todo eso, hay que acostumbrarse.

translation.en: [inmate] And then there's relationship drama, so it gets even worse in here.
translation.es: Y hay dramas de pareja, así que se pone aún peor aquí.

translation.en: One day, the one girl is dating one girl
translation.es: Un día, una chica sale con una

translation.en: and the next day somebody is dating somebody else.
translation.es: y al día siguiente alguien sale con otra.

translation.en: It's like a cluster fuck.
You gotta know who's around you,
you gotta know who you can trust. You gotta know all your enemies.
translation.es: Debes saber en quién puedes confiar. Debes conocer a tus enemigas.

translation.en: [guard] Back it up.
Go to your cells now!
[inmate] But when you find a good friend in here
translation.es: Pero cuando encuentras un buen amigo,

translation.en: it makes the time very easy.
I'm not gonna let this place eat me up or make me miserable.
translation.es: No dejaré que este lugar me carcoma o amargue.

translation.en: [inmate] We might be locked up physically
but mentally and emotionally, I'm-- I'm free as fuck.
translation.es: pero mental y emocionalmente, soy jodidamente libre.

translation.en: Can't nothing stop my shine.
-I'm rollin'! -I'm rollin'!
But it's really bad still. Like, I hate it.
translation.es: Pero sigue siendo muy malo. Lo odio.

translation.en: [male voice on PA] All right, ladies, once again, come out...
translation.es: Muy bien, señoritas, otra vez, salgan...

translation.en: then we'll do day room.
Whatcha doing?
You draw my picture yet?
You got talent, girl! You're gonna go somewhere in life.
translation.es: ¡Tienes talento! Serás alguien en la vida.

translation.en: We're a jail, so most people that are housed here
translation.es: Es una cárcel, así que la mayoría de las personas

translation.en: are either waiting to go to court
translation.es: están esperando ir a un tribunal

translation.en: or they're waiting to be sentenced.
We see all different types of arrests.
Ones from DUI all the way to homicide.
translation.es: Ya sea por conducir borracho u homicidio.

translation.en: All right, I need a shower after you.
I would get in with her, but we can't.
translation.es: Me metería con ella, pero no podemos.

translation.en: Ten percent of the population here are women,
translation.es: El 10 % de la población aquí son mujeres

translation.en: and they're only housed on the 7th floor.
translation.es: y se alojan solo en el séptimo piso.

translation.en: -[door knocks] -What's going on?
[inmate] Let me out!
I need you to calm down
and wait for your turn to go out for day room, all right?
translation.es: y esperes tu turno para ir a la sala, ¿de acuerdo?

translation.en: By law, they only have to let you out for, like, three hours out of the week.
translation.es: Por ley, solo tienen que dejarnos salir tres horas a la semana.

translation.en: Our shifts over here, like, our officers are pretty cool.
translation.es: Los turnos aquí, nuestros oficiales son bastante buenos.

translation.en: So they'll run day room, like, once or twice throughout the day.
translation.es: Nos dejan ir a la sala común una o dos veces en el día.

translation.en: [inmate] Oh, shit!
-[inmate] Good coffee? -Yeah. Thank you.
The things we do in jail.
translation.es: Lo que hacemos en la cárcel.

translation.en: Are you getting in the shower?
[Shawn] I'm in the shower after you, bruh.
translation.es: Yo me ducho después de ti.

translation.en: [Shawn] I've been here for almost 90 days
and I'm finally getting out of here.
translation.es: y por fin voy a salir.

translation.en: Just the anticipation of knowing that I'm going to be free
translation.es: Solo la expectativa de saber que seré libre

translation.en: and be able to walk around, go get food when I want to,
translation.es: y podré caminar por ahí, ir a buscar comida cuando quiera,

translation.en: use the bathroom without having people around me and it smelling like boo boo.
translation.es: usar el baño sin tener gente alrededor, con olor a caca.

translation.en: Teddy, what you got in that bag?
Did you come in with some dope?
Yeah, I got you a doodoo, baby, I got you.
translation.es: Sí, te conseguí un coco, negra.

translation.en: -You do? -I got you a doodoo.
translation.es: - ¿Sí? - Te conseguí un coco, iré a buscarlo.

translation.en: I sure do need it. [chuckles]
I am a convicted armed robber with two strikes.
translation.es: Soy una convicta por robo a mano armada con dos arrestos.

translation.en: Last time I was here, I did 45 days
translation.es: La última vez, estuve aquí 45 días

translation.en: and then this time I'm doing 90 days.
Being in jail sometimes can get easy for me.
translation.es: Estar en la cárcel a veces es fácil para mí.

translation.en: Is your tongue split? Can you go like this?
I get along good with girls because of the way that I look.
translation.es: Me llevo bien con las chicas por mi apariencia.

translation.en: I guess it's my flirtatious personality.
translation.es: Supongo que es mi personalidad coqueta.

translation.en: Okay, I want to get my ears gauged. Does it hurt?
translation.es: Quiero un expansor en la oreja. ¿Duele?

translation.en: Hella ratchet.
Hey, I like it.
There's always somebody that wants to do something,
translation.es: Siempre hay alguien que quiere hacer algo,

translation.en: that wants to cook for me, that wants to give me things.
You can use my phone time, it's good.
translation.es: Puedes usar mi tiempo para llamar.

translation.en: I can use your phone time?
But I'm married.
Even though I'm a big flirt,
I don't want nobody else but my wife.
And so I'm gonna keep my spit in my mouth and my hands to myself.
translation.es: Así que guardaré mi saliva y tendré las manos quietas.

translation.en: [unintelligible yelling] Let me play with your ear! Ah!
Which is going to be...
Yeah, I'ma stay to myself.
Thank you. You are a gem. You just saved my life.
translation.es: Gracias. Eres una joya. Me salvaste la vida.

translation.en: Girl, I was supposed to be outta here four days ago.
translation.es: Se suponía que debía salir hace cuatro días.

translation.en: -Really? -Yes.
Crazy.
[Shawn] It started off when I was young.
My first robbery...
It was kinda funny, 'cause we were watching--
I was at the movies.
And I was with my ex girlfriend.
We were watching one of those shoot 'em up bang-bang movies.
translation.es: Estábamos viendo una de esas películas de tiros.

translation.en: We were carrying knives.
And I kinda just hinted around like, "We should rob these girls behind us."
translation.es: Y yo insinué: "Deberíamos robarles a las chicas de atrás".

translation.en: So, at the end of the movie, she was like, "You ready?" I was like, "For what?"
translation.es: Al final de la película, ella dijo: "¿Estás lista?", y yo: "¿Para qué?".

translation.en: She was like, "To go rob these girls." And I was like, "You're serious?"
translation.es: Ella dijo: "Para robarles a estas chicas". Dije: "Vas en serio".

translation.en: And I'll never forget,
she asked one of the girls, "Can I have some change?"
translation.es: ella le dijo a una de las chicas: "¿Me puedes dar cambio?".

translation.en: And the girl was like, "Yeah, sure. How much you need?"
translation.es: Y la chica dijo: "Sí, claro. ¿Cuánto necesitas?".

translation.en: She was like, "Matter of fact, can I have your whole purse?"
translation.es: Ella dijo: "De hecho, ¿me puedes dar tu cartera?".

translation.en: So, we pulled out the knives...
and we took their purse,
and it was the most pointless thing that I've ever done.
translation.es: y fue lo más inútil que he hecho.

translation.en: We didn't get no money from it.
And it kinda started a chain of events that just spiraled out of control.
translation.es: Y comenzó una cadena de eventos que se salió de control.

translation.en: -You wanna play? -I don't know how to play.
-You know how to play? -Uh-huh.
[Shawn] Do you wanna...
...buy some pills?
- Buy some what? - Pills
-The pills? -Do you want to?
Oh. Like what?
Um... noo-noos?
Or na-nas.
What's noo-noos or na-nas?
Neuron?
Okay, hold on.
Some black?
Oh! Hell no, not that.
Booda!
Explain to her what a na-na make you feel like.
translation.es: Explícale cómo te hace sentir una na-na.

translation.en: Makes you feel like you smoked a blunt.
translation.es: Es como si fumaras un porro.

translation.en: Oh, no. I'm good.
-I don't like it. -But in a good way.
translation.es: - No me gusta. - Pero para bien.

translation.en: There's like microphones over my head.
Oh.
This was just a drill.
Everybody says that I'm a monster, but looks can be deceiving.
translation.es: Todos dicen que soy un monstruo, pero las apariencias engañan.

translation.en: I've got almost half my body covered in tattoos.
translation.es: Tengo casi la mitad del cuerpo tatuado. MONSTRUO

translation.en: I kind of have, like, my good and innocent side and then my monster side.
translation.es: Tengo como mi lado inocente y mi lado de monstruo.

translation.en: Girl, you know you want this dick.
translation.es: Nena, sabes que quieres esta verga.

translation.en: I'm from the east coast.
So, I grew up over there.
I was living in New York.
I was happy.
I had my own place. I was running a business on 5th Avenue.
translation.es: Tenía mi casa. Manejaba un negocio en la quinta avenida.

translation.en: I was doing tattoo conventions.
Then side money would be, like, hustling and selling drugs.
translation.es: Y ganaba dinero extra estafando y vendiendo drogas.

translation.en: I got locked up on the east coast. I did three months over there,
translation.es: Me encarcelaron en la costa este. Estuve tres meses allí,

translation.en: then once I got released, I came over here,
translation.es: luego me liberaron y vine aquí.

translation.en: and I've been mainly in the streets, just hustling and doing that whole thing.
translation.es: He estado en la calle sobre todo, estafando y haciendo todo eso.

translation.en: My charges originally were possession of a stolen vehicle, GTA,
translation.es: Mis cargos al principio fueron robo y posesión de un vehículo robado,

translation.en: transportation of narcotics,
13 pounds of weed, 65 grams of meth,
translation.es: 6 kg de marihuana, 65 g de metanfetamina,

translation.en: fictitious checks, and catching felonies while out on bail.
translation.es: cheques falsos y delitos graves mientras estaba en libertad bajo fianza.

translation.en: It took me
getting locked up to, like, look at my life
translation.es: estar encerrada para mirar mi vida

translation.en: and be like, "Okay, you're fucking up, you're fucking up.
What are you doing that got you in here?
What's the real reason I'm in here? Or, you know, how am I treating people?"
translation.es: ¿Por qué estoy aquí verdaderamente? ¿Cómo trato a las personas?".

translation.en: [producer] Well, and frankly, you're also committing crimes.
translation.es: Bueno y, sinceramente, estás cometiendo delitos.

translation.en: Well, yes, I mean, that too, but... [chuckles]
Hi, I need to bail myself out.
Given my experience,
it is unusual for a first-time offender to come into custody
translation.es: es raro que alguien sin antecedentes penales sea detenido

translation.en: with as serious of charges as she has.
translation.es: por cargos tan graves como los de ella.

translation.en: Miss Sundermeyer's bail is set at $100,000.
translation.es: La fianza de la señorita Sundermeyer se fijó en $100 000.

translation.en: If she does not post bail, she will be here until her arraignment.
translation.es: Si no paga la fianza, estará aquí hasta la lectura de cargos.

translation.en: [bail bondsman] Okay. How much is your bail?
I can't hear what you're saying.
One hundred thousand.
One hundred thousand?
Okay. What did you get arrested for?
I got arrested for carjacking.
translation.es: Me arrestaron por secuestro de vehículo.

translation.en: Okay, how much money do you have for bail?
translation.es: Bueno, ¿cuánto dinero tienes para la fianza?

translation.en: How much is it to do a payment plan?
translation.es: ¿Cuánto necesito para un plan de pago?

translation.en: I can do--
I don't even know who you are.
Okay, my name is--
You won't give me how much money you have.
translation.es: No me dices cuánto dinero tienes.

translation.en: You're just bullshit. You hear that? [phone line beeps]
I'm bullshit?
What the fuck?
I'm bullshit, I guess. I'm just bullshit.
translation.es: Soy una mentirosa, supongo. Una mentirosa.

translation.en: Hi, I need to bail myself out. It's for a $100,000 bail.
translation.es: Hola, necesito pagar una fianza de $100 000 para salir en libertad.

translation.en: Eight thousand?
How much can we do for a payment plan?
translation.es: ¿Con cuánto podemos hacer un plan de pago?

translation.en: -[unintelligible] -You can't do any less than that?
I can do, like, $500.
I don't know. I just wanna go home.
translation.es: No sé. Solo quiero irme a casa.

translation.en: [sobbing] I'm not going to see my baby.
translation.es: No voy a ver a mi bebé.

translation.en: [Yasmin] I'm not a mean person.
I want to be a veterinarian, like...
I want to be back to how it was before, going to school,
translation.es: Quiero volver a cómo era antes, ir a la escuela,

translation.en: when I was happy, seeing my baby happy.
translation.es: cuando era feliz, ver a mi bebé feliz.

translation.en: Like, that just all made me happy.
I was supposed to be at work today at seven...
translation.es: Hoy debía estar en el trabajo a las 7...

translation.en: or something. I don't know. I just...
I need to stop.
I just wanna be happy.
I always do this to myself.
translation.es: Siempre me hago esto a mí misma.

translation.en: I'll have everything, you know, being good,
instead I just ruin it.
[Shawn] I get to go! I'm so excited.
So now I'm just waiting to get released.
translation.es: Ahora solo espero que me liberen.

translation.en: They'll probably release you after dinner.
translation.es: Seguro lo harán después de cenar.

translation.en: [chuckles] Oh, my God. I'm going back to sleep.
I'm not gonna be able to sleep. Hope they give us day room.
translation.es: No podré dormir. Espero que nos dejen ir a la sala.

translation.en: Yeah, I don't see how you'll be able to sleep. [chuckles]
translation.es: Sí, no sé cómo podrías dormir.

translation.en: I'm ready to go. I can't believe it.
translation.es: Estoy lista para salir. No puedo creerlo.

translation.en: Look, man...
This is my old bunkie. Like, I love her. I love her so much.
translation.es: Ella es mi vieja compañera de celda. La amo. La amo mucho.

translation.en: You guys always find a way back to each other.
translation.es: Siempre hallan el modo de estar juntas.

translation.en: It's precious.
I feel like-- I keep fighting a lot, huh? And don't realize it.
translation.es: Siento que sigo peleando mucho, ¿no? Y no me doy cuenta.

translation.en: Yeah, you do.
-I thought I fought a lot. -That part, though.
translation.es: - Yo creía que peleaba mucho. - Esa parte.

translation.en: People don't fuck with me no more.
translation.es: Pero la gente ya no me jode.

translation.en: I got into four fights already.
Some people call me sweet, some people call me mean. Like...
translation.es: Algunos dicen que soy dulce, otros dicen que soy mala...

translation.en: I am who I am.
I'm a...
nice ass real bitch.
I love this lady right here.
She is so crazy.
I can honestly sit here and say, like, I trust her with my life.
translation.es: Sinceramente, puedo sentarme y decir que a ella le confío mi vida.

translation.en: Wouldn't want to be anyone else's bunkie.
[Noonie] She's my lighter to a cigarette, like...
translation.es: Ella es el encendedor para mi cigarro.

translation.en: Like that, you know? Like...
We go together, so...
-[Monster] Love you, Noonie! -We're just...
I love you, too, Monster.
I'm in here for pimping and pandering.
translation.es: Estoy aquí por proxenetismo y explotación.

translation.en: Um, my bail is $1,000,000.
I've been here for a year-- Thirteen months, actually.
translation.es: Estoy aquí hace un año... 13 meses, en realidad.

translation.en: I had a pretty decent childhood.
I mean, I was in and out of foster care.
translation.es: Entraba y salía de hogares de guarda.

translation.en: Everybody dreams of being a lawyer and a doctor,
translation.es: Todos sueñan con ser abogados o doctores,

translation.en: but I wanted to be a social worker,
translation.es: pero yo quería ser trabajadora social,

translation.en: because I was in and out of the system.
translation.es: porque entraba y salía del sistema.

translation.en: I'ma go back to school when I get out, go to college, you know.
translation.es: Cuando salga regresaré a la escuela, iré a la universidad.

translation.en: I'm not really trippin'.
Noham.
Hey, you on the end. Your feet that way.
translation.es: El de la punta. Los pies hacia allá.

translation.en: Two more fingers. We have two more fingers.
[male officer] File in.
I am getting her jail clothing ready.
translation.es: Estoy preparando su ropa para la cárcel.

translation.en: She said she's not gonna bail out and she'd like to go upstairs.
translation.es: Dijo que no saldrá bajo fianza y le gustaría ir arriba.

translation.en: So, this is the jail rolls.
translation.es: Esta es la ropa para la cárcel.

translation.en: Jail shoes.
Our jail underwear and bra.
So, sometimes we have brand new ones, and then sometimes...
translation.es: A veces tenemos sin estrenar y otras veces...

translation.en: they look like this.
Pull that door.
So, I'm going to need you to get fully undressed.
translation.es: Necesito que te desvistas por completo.

translation.en: Put all your clothing in this clear plastic bag.
translation.es: Pon toda tu ropa en esta bolsa de plástico transparente.

translation.en: Okay. Completely naked. Socks, shoes, everything.
Okay.
Thank you.
All right, now turn, face me.
Stand on those yellow footprints.
Bend forward at the waist.
Reach behind you from behind with both hands,
translation.es: Pasa los dos manos por detrás,

translation.en: spread yourself open, cough hard three times.
You have to get your fingers closer to your vagina,
translation.es: Debes llevar los dedos más cerca de tu vagina,

translation.en: spread yourself open, cough hard three times.
Okay.
Here's your clothing. Get dressed.
And then come on out. Stand right here and face the wall.
translation.es: Sal de ahí. Párate aquí y mira la pared.

translation.en: Hands are considered weapons in this facility,
translation.es: La manos se consideran armas en este centro,

translation.en: so make sure they're in the front waistband of your pants
translation.es: así que asegúrate de tenerlas al frente

translation.en: whenever you're walking by any kind of staff.
translation.es: cuando te cruces con cualquier empleado.

translation.en: Seven East from female booking. One en route, escorted.
translation.es: Siete Este registro femenino. Una en camino, escoltada.

translation.en: We're heading this way, to your right.
translation.es: Vamos por aquí a tu derecha.

translation.en: [Salazar] Let's walk up these stairs.
[inmate] We don't want you!
That's my friend.
[Yasmin] I have a question. This cell is dirty.
translation.es: Una pregunta. Esta celda está sucia.

translation.en: Can I get a clean cell?
No, you can't get a different cell.
translation.es: No, no puedes ir a otra celda.

translation.en: But I just want one that was wiped off.
translation.es: Quiero una que la hayan limpiado.

translation.en: Yeah, it was.
Our workers cleaned. There's nothing on the ground.
translation.es: Las empleadas limpiaron. No hay nada en el piso.

translation.en: [man] Okay, yuck it up, ass-jackal. You're on camera.
translation.es: Bueno, ríete, tonto. Estás en cámara.

translation.en: [Wolverine] Being on the Trustee floor is so different.
Bro, we've got it made here, bro.
We get food, we get our own cell,
translation.es: Nos dan comida, nuestra propia celda,

translation.en: we get TVs, we get...
phones all day.
We can sit in the hallway and look at all the women.
translation.es: Podemos mirar a las mujeres desde el pasillo.

translation.en: -All day! -All day long.
I see you!
She was screaming last time.
[man] We're called workers, or trustees.
We all have to wear these white shirts.
You know, you have to get classified and go through a certain criteria
translation.es: Debemos estar clasificados y cumplir con ciertos criterios

translation.en: to be eligible to work down here.
We work our asses off down here.
[Wolverine] What's up, pimp?
High-five! High-five!
Ha, gotcha! [chuckles]
Oh, my God.
[Wolverine] What's up with you, girl?
I'm doing all right.
Just slip on through.
Yeah.
Funny thing, you making friends always everywhere we go.
translation.es: Lo curioso es que siempre te haces amigas en todas partes.

translation.en: Hey, what do you want me to do?
I'm a friendly guy, you know?
[Wolverine] We're going to seven where all his fans are.
translation.es: Vamos al séptimo piso donde están sus fanáticas.

translation.en: [man] Oh, yeah!
All the girls are gonna be, "Oh! Wolverine!"
[man] Happens every time.
Look at him.
He has the chops, the hair. That's his hero.
translation.es: Tiene los cortes, el pelo. Es su héroe.

translation.en: [Wolverine] When I was in prison about eight years ago,
translation.es: Cuando estuve en prisión hace unos ocho años,

translation.en: we didn't have access to mirrors and razors, but maybe once a month,
translation.es: solo teníamos acceso a espejos y afeitadoras una vez al mes quizá,

translation.en: so I just kinda cut it,
and then there were telling me, "You look like Wolverine,"
translation.es: y luego me decían: "Te pareces a Wolverine",

translation.en: so I kinda went with it. Gives me strength, you know?
translation.es: así que les seguí la corriente. Me da fuerza.

translation.en: Be something strong, you know what I mean?
Hopefully it's my last trip here. Been here a lot of times.
translation.es: Espero que sea la última vez. Estuve aquí muchas veces.

translation.en: I'm trying to find some help when I get out there,
so I don't end up back here, at the same spot.
translation.es: así no termino de vuelta aquí en el mismo lugar.

translation.en: [chuckles] What's up?
Generally, we're not allowed to communicate with the females.
translation.es: No nos dejan comunicarnos con las mujeres.

translation.en: Sometimes we cross paths.
What's up, girl? What's happening? You know what I mean?
translation.es: ¿Qué tal, nena? ¿Qué pasa? ¿Sabes lo que digo?

translation.en: They come up and they ask me to sign my poster, all that.
translation.es: Vienen y me piden que les firme el afiche, todo eso.

translation.en: I can't do that.
I love cupcakes.
I got cupcakes. I mean...
translation.es: - Amo los pastelitos. - Yo tengo. Es decir...

translation.en: [Becky] Well, those are not very fluffy.
What's wrong with them? They're fluffy.
[Becky] More squats.
More squats? Oh!
That's out.
Right? [male officer] What are you doing on this floor?
[Wolverine] I don't want to get fired.
Bye, Becky.
-[man] I knew you'd get us in trouble. -[Wolverine chuckles]
translation.es: Sabía que nos meterías en líos.

translation.en: [Rowland] Those male workers should not have been talking to those female workers.
translation.es: Esos trabajadores no deberían hablar con las trabajadoras.

translation.en: [male officer] I guess that's why they don't call them trustees any more, right?
translation.es: Supongo que por eso ya no los llaman consejeros, ¿no?

translation.en: Yeah. Understatement.
[male officer] They call 'em workers.
You know, what's crazy is you go to eighth floor,
translation.es: Lo loco es que vas al octavo piso,

translation.en: where a lot of your...
shot callers are,
and if those guys have clout enough to get dope through the workers,
translation.es: y si ellos tienen peso para conseguir droga con los trabajadores,

translation.en: it just comes straight from the eighth floor, the top floor,
translation.es: viene directo del octavo piso, el último piso,

translation.en: all the way down.
At first I thought it was an issue on seven and eight,
translation.es: Creía que era un problema del séptimo y octavo

translation.en: but then you're finding it on...
-all the floors. -Yeah.
A lot of the girls here have ties
with some of their male inmate counterparts,
translation.es: con algunos de sus pares reclusos

translation.en: and I just see a lot of them putting themselves in stupid positions
translation.es: y veo que muchos de ellos se colocan en situaciones estúpidas

translation.en: they don't need to put themselves in.
translation.es: en las que no deben colocarse.

translation.en: That's why we gotta keep hitting cells.
-Yeah. -Maybe they'll get the hint not to...
translation.es: - Sí. - Quizá capten la indirecta y no...

translation.en: float dope through.
Yeah.
Make your way to your rooms. Let's go.
[Shayna] Girl, cut that shit.
[Tayler] Cut that shit up.
The fuckin' boys moved everything.
I dunno where anything's at.
Bunch of assholes.
[Shayna] Shayna Wimberly.
I'm Tayler Coatney.
And we work night shift together.
We do chore time and clean up after the girls.
translation.es: Hacemos tareas y limpiamos lo que ensucian las chicas.

translation.en: We're supposed to be role models. Sometimes, we kind of...
translation.es: Se supone que somos modelos a seguir. A veces, nosotras...

translation.en: We get a little out of hand, but we have fun with it.
translation.es: Se nos va de las manos, pero nos divertimos.

translation.en: -[Tayler] I want to hit you with it. -[Shayna] Yeah, I know.
translation.es: - Quiero pegarte con esto. - Sí, lo sé.

translation.en: [Shayna] You get more freedom being a worker.
We can go into other pods.
We can shower, use the phone.
[Tayler] My door's always popped. Like, all day is day room.
It's nice.
[Shayna] This girl just came into booking.
[Tayler] Where is she? At 28?
[Shayna] Is that her?
[Tayler] Hi.
-[Yasmin] Hello. -What's your name?
Yasmin? That's a pretty name.
Thank you.
-[Yasmin] What's your name? -Tayler.
-Nice to meet you. -I'm Shayna.
[Shayna] We overheard that some girl came in here with a Sawzall blade
translation.es: Oímos por casualidad que una chica vino con la hoja de una sierra,

translation.en: and a fully loaded pipe and a lighter
translation.es: una pipa llena y un encendedor

translation.en: -inside of her. -Yeah, like, she--
Shoved in her, you know, nani.
So, we were-- I was like...
-[chuckles] It was so bad! -She had a hospital band on,
and she, like...
I'm like, "She's walking kinda funny. Maybe that was her, you know."
-[both laugh] -[Tayler] I really thought that was her!
But I mean, like, she's not like that at all.
translation.es: Pero ella no es así en absoluto.

translation.en: She looks super innocent, you know?
If you don't mind us asking, what are you in here for?
translation.es: Si no te molesta que preguntemos, ¿por qué estás aquí?

translation.en: Carjacking.
-[Tayler] That's no fun. How old are you? -I'm 19.
[Tayler] Nineteen? Me, too!
[Yasmin] I'm facing five felonies.
[Shayna] She said carjacking. She made it up.
translation.es: Dijo secuestro de vehículo. Lo inventó.

translation.en: There's "carjacking, assault with deadly weapon on peace officer,
translation.es: "Secuestro de vehículo, ataque con arma mortal a un policía,

translation.en: receiving known stolen motor vehicle,
reckless driving, alcohol and drugs."
Oh, my.
Well, she was on a good one, right?
What time do we come out?
[Tayler] Day room is really whenever they feel like offering it.
translation.es: Podemos salir cuando a ellos se les da la gana.

translation.en: Try to use the phone and try to get a shower in,
translation.es: Trata de usar el teléfono y ducharte

translation.en: 'cause you don't know when your next one's gonna be.
translation.es: porque no sabes cuándo será la próxima vez.

translation.en: Yeah.
-[Yasmin] I wanna see my mom. -[Shayna] It's going to be okay, okay?
translation.es: - Quiero ver a mi mamá. - Todo va a estar bien.

translation.en: You'll get through this.
I'm not gonna lie to you, it's not gonna be easy, but...
translation.es: No voy a mentirte, no será fácil, pero...

translation.en: you'll be okay.
We will see you in a little bit. Okay?
-We'll come check on you, okay? -Try to take it easy.
translation.es: - Vendremos a ver cómo estás. - Tómalo con calma.

translation.en: [Tayler] She was like...
evading and like, assault with a deadly weapon?
translation.es: ...evadió y atacó con un arma mortal?

translation.en: Look at her!
-She's going to be here a minute. -[Tayler] Yeah.
translation.es: - Estará aquí un buen tiempo. - Sí.

translation.en: She'll probably be fighting her case for a couple months.
translation.es: Probablemente defenderá su caso unos meses.

translation.en: [Shayna] I mean, I thought I would be fighting mine for a couple months.
translation.es: Creí que defendería el mío unos meses.

translation.en: I've been here ten months.
I don't even know how many days I have.
translation.es: Ni sé cuántos días me quedan.

translation.en: I might have forever. I might leave tomorrow. I don't know.
translation.es: Puedo estar aquí para siempre o salir mañana. No sé.

translation.en: I'll be here...
I don't know how long.
Long time. I don't even count no more.
translation.es: Mucho tiempo. Ya ni lo cuento.

translation.en: I'm just trying to, trying to wiggle the numbers around
and see what I can do with it.
My max was nine years,
translation.es: Mi sentencia máxima era de nueve años

translation.en: and doubled, since I'm a striker.
translation.es: y se duplicó por ser reincidente.

translation.en: He wanted to do four years doubled, which means eight years.
translation.es: Quisieron darme cuatro años duplicados, o sea, ocho años.

translation.en: With the seven years and 85%,
translation.es: Con los siete años y el 85 %,

translation.en: I've already been two years flat.
I have to do a 90-day commitment first,
translation.es: Primero tengo un compromiso de 90 días

translation.en: and then consecutive 150 days with half.
translation.es: y luego la mitad de 150 días.

translation.en: That offer came down to 16 months doubled.
translation.es: La oferta se redujo a 16 meses duplicados.

translation.en: Eighty-five percent of seven would be, like, five years, eight months.
translation.es: El 85 % de siete serían cinco años y ocho meses.

translation.en: And then two years on top of that that'd be like three years, eight months.
translation.es: Menos los dos años, serían tres años y ocho meses.

translation.en: Which means 32 months.
Once I get there, they'll knock off 16 months.
translation.es: Cuando llegue a eso, bajarán 16 meses.

translation.en: And then 85% hopefully will go down to 66%
translation.es: Y luego el 85 % con suerte se reducirá a 66 %

translation.en: when I get over the wall in prison.
I have four months already in,
which doubles to eight months, so I would have eight months left.
translation.es: que se duplican, así que me quedarían ocho meses.

translation.en: It would just be way lower than that.
I'd probably have two years left to do.
So...
-[producer] I'm a little confused. -[inmate laughs]
So I'm fucked.
Yeah. Don't go to jail. [chuckles]
translation.es: Sí. No vayan a la cárcel.

translation.en: [male officer] Chow-time, chow-time, chow-time.
Pop your doors. Come out and grab one tray
translation.es: Abran la puerta. Salgan, agarren una bandeja

translation.en: and return to your cell. Do not try to grab an extra tray for yourself.
translation.es: y vuelvan a sus celdas. No intenten agarrar otra bandeja.

translation.en: That's a long-ass line!
Whatcha want me to do? Push these bitches out the way?
See this nasty-ass food?
Fake-ass chicken strips.
This some beans. Nasty-ass carrots.
[Monster] That's called, "I'm hungry."
I don't know if I'm doing this pruno right, but... [inhales]
translation.es: No sé si estoy haciendo bien el pruno, pero...

translation.en: It's really just oranges and pineapples, but...
translation.es: Es solo naranjas y piñas, pero...

translation.en: we probably won't get no more pineapples.
translation.es: Seguro no nos darán más piñas.

translation.en: [Monster] Pruno is alcohol.
It's usually made with fruit.
[Noonie] I always make the best mother-fucking drink.
It's not infrequent for us to find pruno,
translation.es: No es raro que encontremos pruno,

translation.en: as far as cell searches and shakedowns are concerned.
We'll obviously confiscate it.
It's one of the easiest things to make in jail,
translation.es: Es fácil de hacer en la cárcel,

translation.en: as long as you have some form of a sugary substance,
access to fruit, which we give them on a daily basis
translation.es: acceso a frutas, que les damos a diario

translation.en: and warm water, which they also have access to.
translation.es: y agua caliente, que también tienen acceso a ello.

translation.en: You put it in a bag, wait for like a week or so...
translation.es: Lo pones en una bolsa, esperas una semana más o menos...

translation.en: You gotta burp it when the bag blows up.
translation.es: Debes sacarle el aire cuando la bolsa se infla.

translation.en: Then it's done.
[Drea] Whatcha doing in there, girl?
-Bitch there's nothing but food in here. -[laughter]
[Noonie] Leave me alone.
Better, like, talking to my fucking self.
[Drea] Okay.
All right!
I don't fuck with Drea.
I'm here for burglary.
translation.es: Estoy aquí por robo en una casa.

translation.en: Jail gets a little boring, so I like to entertain myself
translation.es: La cárcel se vuelve algo aburrida, así que me gusta entretenerme

translation.en: and my way of doing that is with females.
translation.es: y mi forma de hacerlo es con las chicas.

translation.en: [Drea] I have a lot of females in here that do want to be with me.
translation.es: Hay muchas chicas aquí que quieren estar conmigo.

translation.en: There's kinda a lot of ducks in here.
There's not really too many pretty people right now.
I'm not gonna waste my time with no ducks.
translation.es: No perderé mi tiempo con patos.

translation.en: Unless they're profitable.
If they got something for me, commissary or something. I don't know.
translation.es: Si tienen algo para mí, provisiones o algo. No sé.

translation.en: You've got straight bitches, bisexual bitches,
and then you got bi-choosy bitches.
Wait, you're telling me I'm choosy?
There's always drama behind Drea.
She wants attention whether it be negative or positive.
translation.es: Ella quiere atención, sea negativa o positiva.

translation.en: She's an agitator.
If she causes an argument with somebody, it gets our day room shut down.
translation.es: Si empieza una discusión con alguien, no nos dejan estar en la sala.

translation.en: [male officer on PA] O-rec! Go to O-rec. Again, O-rec, go to O-rec.
translation.es: ¡Recreo al aire libre! Vamos. Repito, recreo.

translation.en: [inmate] Come on, you don't need to be on TV. [inmate 2] I know
translation.es: - Vamos, no necesitas salir en TV. - Lo sé.

translation.en: I'm finna watch.
-[woman 2] Hey, girl! -[woman 1] Whatcha doing?
She's tryin to get at me, girl. Gotta get the good view.
translation.es: Intenta llegar a mí. Debo tener una buena vista.

translation.en: [inmate] Look at these thirsty-ass thots.
translation.es: Mira estas perras sedientas de atención.

translation.en: [woman 2] Oh, hell no! I'm gonna be on.
It's hard to hear them. They're so far down there.
translation.es: Es difícil oírlas. Están muy lejos.

translation.en: [woman 1] It's heavy. I can tell.
Yes.
[male officer on PA] All right, ladies, outdoor rec is over.
translation.es: Bien, señoritas, se acabó el recreo.

translation.en: Please return to your cells.
[Rowland] Ladies!
Why are we screwing up already?
Quiet!
We could have easily put you guys on lockdown
for that little stint you guys pulled in outdoor rec.
translation.es: por el lío que hicieron en el recreo.

translation.en: -[unintelligible protest] -Hold on!
There were a group of people screaming at people on the streets
translation.es: Un grupo de personas le gritó a personas de la calle

translation.en: and it caught someone's attention outside.
translation.es: y llamó la atención de alguien de afuera.

translation.en: [inmate] Yes, we understand. We apologize.
Which one apologizes?
[inmate] It was an old man,
and I couldn't tell if he was my lawyer.
translation.es: y no sabía si era mi abogado.

translation.en: There are many old men walking the streets of downtown Sacramento.
translation.es: Muchos hombres caminan por el centro de Sacramento.

translation.en: I highly doubt that was your attorney in particular.
translation.es: Dudo mucho que haya sido tu abogado.

translation.en: All right!
If you guys have questions, I will answer them
as I do the next cell check.
[male officer on PA] Into your cells for lockdown.
translation.es: A sus celdas para el bloqueo.

translation.en: -[male officer on PA] Hey, Beason. -[Shawn] Yes?
Beason, roll up your stuff. You're getting released.
translation.es: Beason, junta tus cosas. Serás liberada.

translation.en: -Okay, I'm rolled up. -[cellmate] Amen!
-[cellmate] Bye, girl! -[Shawn] Bye.
-[cellmate] Good luck! -[Shawn] Thank you.
[cellmate] Don't forget.
[Shawn] Yeah, they just let me go.
I'll try not to.
Alright, head on down towards the elevator for me, please.
translation.es: Dirígete hacia el ascensor, por favor.

translation.en: Thank you. There you go.
Let a real one free.
[male officer] All right. There you go.
[Shawn] I don't want to do this forever.
It's time for me to grow up.
I want to go back to school.
I'm willing to, you know, work hard, I guess, for money.
translation.es: Estoy dispuesta a trabajar duro, supongo, por dinero.

translation.en: And not just take it.
Hey, babe!
I'm in the release tank. You here to pick me up?
translation.es: Estoy esperando que me liberen. ¿Viniste a buscarme?

translation.en: [Christine] I'm here.
-Are you going to be in the same spot? -Yeah.
Okay, I'll see you in a minute. Okay?
All right.
[Shawn] My wife, I know that she loves me.
translation.es: Sé que mi esposa me ama.

translation.en: She's there for me as much as she can right now, but it's tough for her.
translation.es: Está para mí todo lo que puede, pero es difícil para ella.

translation.en: Every time I go to jail,
it seems like it's longer and longer each time I go back.
translation.es: parece que es cada vez más y más tiempo.

translation.en: Come on. My ride is waiting.
We're a team, and when a piece of the team is gone,
translation.es: Somos un equipo y cuando falta una parte del equipo,

translation.en: it just makes it hard.
-Is there a Ms. Beason? -Yes.
Go ahead and step out right here.
Right around this way. Follow that yellow line down.
translation.es: Por aquí. Siga la línea amarilla.

translation.en: Yes.
Stop right there.
Face the wall.
Officer?
Why am I going in here?
Still in the process of processing your release.
Your parole officer decided they wanted to place a hold.
translation.es: Su agente de la condicional ordenó la retención.

translation.en: So you're not gonna be going home at this time until your parole officer...
translation.es: Así que no irá a casa hasta que su agente de la condicional...

translation.en: takes care of all that.
[Shawn] Shit.
Oh, my gosh, this is crazy.
translation.es: Dios mío. Esto es una locura.

translation.en: [Hernandez] When I first was assigned to the Intel and Classification Unit,
translation.es: Cuando me asignaron a la Unidad de Inteligencia y Clasificación,

translation.en: everybody had a theme to their desk.
A football theme, puppies theme, and then they asked me,
translation.es: Uno de fútbol, otro de cachorritos, y me preguntaron:

translation.en: "What is your theme going to be?"
And I thought it was a joke.
So I said, "I don't know, unicorns farting out rainbows?"
translation.es: Y dije: "No sé, ¿unicornios que se tiran pedos de arcoíris?".

translation.en: Well, they decided to decorate my cubicle.
So I just kept the theme and now we got it going.
translation.es: Así que me quedé con el tema y ahora tenemos todo.

translation.en: It was at one point a really blowed-up unicorn
translation.es: En un momento fue un unicornio inflado

translation.en: and it had Skittles coming out of the mouth.
translation.es: y le salían confites de la boca.

translation.en: We have to do our best in our facilities to ensure that everybody is safe.
translation.es: Tenemos que hacer todo lo posible para garantizar que todos estén a salvo.

translation.en: It's in human nature for...
especially inmates here to break rules and violate rules.
translation.es: ...sobre todo de los reclusos romper y violar las reglas.

translation.en: We can't catch everything, but it happens.
translation.es: No podemos captar todo, pero sucede.

translation.en: [Hernandez] Girls, get fully dressed.
Jones, I need you in the classroom now.
-[Monster] What the fuck? -[Noonie] Why?
Get fully dressed.
[Monster] All right, we coming.
That hella fucked up, man.
Because we have approximately 135 inmates that are booked daily,
translation.es: Como ingresan aproximadamente 135 reclusas por día,

translation.en: we try to conduct shakedowns as often as we can.
translation.es: inspeccionamos las celdas siempre que podemos.

translation.en: And sometimes, we can get tips from other inmates.
translation.es: Y a veces, otras reclusas nos dan datos.

translation.en: They'll let us know, "Hey, something's going on in this cell."
translation.es: Nos avisan: "Oye, en esa celda pasa algo".

translation.en: Do you want to go through this side and I'll go through this side.
translation.es: ¿Quieres revisar este lado y yo reviso este otro?

translation.en: Don't know why she has all this.
translation.es: No sé por qué tiene todo esto.

translation.en: [Rowland] Table's clear.
[Noonie] Somebody snitched on me.
So, they raided my room.
They always like to throw around my shit.
translation.es: Siempre les gusta tirar mis cosas.

translation.en: It was like a handful of people that knew I had pruno, so...
translation.es: Pocas personas sabían que tenía pruno, así que...

translation.en: bitches was hating.
[Rowland] This bag's clear.
We got some joy juice.
Some pruno.
[female officer] Oh, nice.
I'm hella mad, 'cause they probably found my pruno.
translation.es: Estoy muy enojada porque seguro hallaron mi pruno.

translation.en: [Rowland] Kickstart our Friday.
[female officer] Happy Friday.
I have disciplinary hearings
for Hawkins and Jones out of 118.
translation.es: para Hawkins y Jones de la 118.

translation.en: [Hernandez] Hi, Hawkins.
Sgt. Hernandez, I'm here to do your hearing.
Hi, Jones. How are you?
Tired. I wanna go back to sleep.
[Hernandez] And I'm tired, too.
So apparently, some officers did some shakedowns
and they found a plastic bag, odor of an alcoholic beverage,
translation.es: y hallaron una bolsa de plástico, olor a bebida alcohólica

translation.en: and they found pruno in your cell.
I mean, it's just...
I don't know whose it is.
There's no way it was a gallon and a half.
How much do you think it was? Maybe a couple cups?
translation.es: ¿Cuánto crees que era? ¿Un par de copas quizá?

translation.en: So you're pleading guilty or not guilty?
I plead the fifth.
[Hernandez] This is just basically in-house rules.
You're not gonna get extra charges if that's what you think.
translation.es: No tendrás más cargos si eso es lo que crees.

translation.en: -Penal Code charges. -[Monster] I'm gonna say I'm not guilty,
translation.es: - Cargos penales. - Diré que soy inocente

translation.en: because it's not... I don't know whose it is.
translation.es: porque no es... No sé de quién es.

translation.en: Was it good stuff?
Did you make it?
-No. -Did you even taste test it?
[Noonie] No. I wish I did.
So are you saying this is your stuff that was in here?
translation.es: ¿Dices que lo que había aquí es tuyo?

translation.en: No, I'm not saying that.
So whose pruno was it?
-Miraculously-- -I don't even know how to make pruno.
translation.es: - Milagrosamente... - Ni sé cómo hacer pruno.

translation.en: And you were just waiting to drink it.
So, some magical unicorn came into your cell
translation.es: Entonces, un unicornio mágico entró en tu celda

translation.en: and put this whole bag of pruno inside your cell.
translation.es: y dejó esta bolsa llena de pruno.

translation.en: Is that what you're telling me?
I appreciate you saying that you were ready to drink
translation.es: Gracias por decir que estabas lista para tomarlo

translation.en: and you knew it was in, acknowledged that it was in your cell.
translation.es: y reconocer que sabías que estaba en tu celda.

translation.en: I'm going to find you guilty, even though you plead not guilty.
translation.es: Te declararé culpable aunque tú te declares inocente.

translation.en: You're going to get the max of 15 days.
Do you know what it means to be on restriction?
Have you been?
I can't come out in day room.
translation.es: No puedo ir a la sala común.

translation.en: Yeah, no day room,
translation.es: Sí, no puedes ir a la sala,

translation.en: you get a disciplinary shower every other day.
translation.es: tienes una ducha disciplinaria cada dos días.

translation.en: You're allowed to have legal mail and make legal phone calls,
translation.es: Puedes tener correo legal y hacer llamadas legales,

translation.en: and that is it.
Do you have any questions?
All right, go ahead and check back in and head back.
translation.es: Muy bien, ve a registrarte y regresa.

translation.en: [Shawn] This is crazy.
Hi, I'm not getting released.
[Christine] What?
[Shawn] My parole officer put a parole hold on me.
translation.es: El agente de la condicional pidió la retención.

translation.en: I'm sorry, Christine.
This time I came to jail, it's been a struggle on me and my wife.
translation.es: Esta vez que entré a la cárcel, ha sido duro para mí y mi esposa.

translation.en: She isn't working, and she's doing the best that she can.
translation.es: Ella no está trabajando y hace lo mejor que puede.

translation.en: Do you love me?
Would you be able to do me a favor?
Could you send me some money?
Wow, are you serious right now?
Yes.
I don't have any. You need to grow up.
Now I gotta get back dressed into oranges.
translation.es: Ahora tengo que volver vestida de naranja.

translation.en: [female officer] You're going to get completely undressed. Put everything in this bag.
translation.es: Desvístete por completo. Pon todo en esta bolsa.

translation.en: Okay?
[inmate] Shawn? I thought you were leaving.
[Shawn] Bro, I'll tell you later.
[inmate] Okay.
I really did wanna drink that shit.
translation.es: De verdad quería tomar esa mierda.

translation.en: Probably would've been good right now.
I wouldn't admit to it
even if I did or didn't make it.
translation.es: aunque lo hubiera hecho o no.

translation.en: I'm not gonna admit to that.
I'm not gonna incriminate myself or anybody
translation.es: No me voy a incriminar o incriminar a nadie

translation.en: um, in that matter.
I think she shoulda got ten days.
I think I should have gotten nothing, but--

translation.en: Or, that's true.
Somebody...
definitely opened their mouth.
It's... wrong.
There's no need for somebody else to put their nose in anybody else's business.

translation.en: [Monster] It's not really hard to figure out
who's talking.
Especially in here.

and observe.

-Opened their mouth. -Yes.

You know?
The one who didn't want it.

Okay, okay.
If you snitch, then you're going to get to meet my fist.

And...
I know I fucked with my freedom by getting myself here.

I love it.

[yelling] Team Monster Gang! Yeah, yeah!
-[yells] Noonie Squad! -[both] Yeah, yeah!

Hello!
Yo, Andrea Gunderson is a mother-fucking snitch

Do what?

translation.en: Yeah, that bitch snitching is a scaredy-ass bitch.

-[male inmate] What cell is she in though? -She in 28.
[male inmate] It's always good to know about people like that
translation.es: Sabrá lo que le hacemos a esa gente aquí.

translation.en: cause snitching is a no-no.
Snitching is a no-no, okay?
Fuck these snitches, man!
Yeah, I be talking on the toilet.
It's fun. It's better talking to the boys
translation.es: Es divertido. Es mejor hablar con los chicos

translation.en: than these raggedy-ass girls all the time.
translation.es: que con estas roñosas todo el tiempo.

translation.en: Hey, bruh.
-Hello? -Hello!
-Hello? -Who's this?
What are you doing?
I had just got here from juvenile hall
and so, I didn't know anything about toilet talking or any of that.
translation.es: No sabía nada de hablar por el inodoro.

translation.en: My bunkie was like, "There's some guys banging on our line."
translation.es: Mi compañera dijo: "Unos chicos llaman a nuestra línea".

translation.en: -Hello? -What are you talking about?
-Hello. -People were talking into the toilet?
-Like, really? -Yeah?
I miss you!
So, to talk on the toilet bowl, you have to bail out.
translation.es: Para hablar por el inodoro, debes tirar la cadena.

translation.en: You take all the water out, dump it in the sink.
translation.es: Sacas toda el agua, la tiras en el lavabo.

translation.en: She bailed the toilet out and knocked, and somebody answered.
translation.es: Ella vació el inodoro, golpeó y alguien contestó.

translation.en: I was like, "Oh my God, what is happening here?"
Everybody has their own knock,
because there's people on the eighth floor, on the sixth floor,
translation.es: porque hay gente en el octavo, en el sexto,

translation.en: there's people on the fifth floor.
You can even talk to the boys on the fourth floor.
translation.es: Hasta puedes hablar con los chicos del cuarto.

translation.en: You can barely hear them, it's very quiet.
I hear you, motherfucker.
Is there any bitches on the line?
[female inmate] I've been trying to get bitches on the line for a minute!
translation.es: ¡Hace rato que no hay ninguna en la línea!

translation.en: And then you can, like, create a relationship.
I've been missing you all my life.
He was hella hot, and I was like, "Ooh, okay.
translation.es: Él estaba muy bueno y dije: "Oh, bien.

translation.en: Talk to me."
This is my microphone. Hello?
Oh, hello?
I was like, "Oh, my gosh, this is so cool.
It's like having a cell phone!"
Hey, you hear me?
Who is this?
-It's Graham. -I'm on six.
Nah, I'm a white boy.
-Whatcha want me to tell her? -I don't know who figured it out,
translation.es: - ¿Qué quieres que le diga? - No sé quién lo descubrió,

translation.en: but whoever first did it was a genius,
translation.es: pero el que lo hizo era un genio

translation.en: 'cause that's real science, for real.
All right.
He flushed, so he hung up the phone, so...
translation.es: Tiró la cadena, así que colgó el teléfono...

translation.en: That's it.
I see you, bitch.
Be cool.
Okay. Just...

-You got 15 days lockdown? -Yeah.
They gave me 15 fucking days.
Damn.
Just leave it alone.
You know, it's not that big of a deal. Ain't no one going to do shit.

translation.en: I know she ain't talking to me.

We all know you tellin'.
Excuse me? That's one thing I'm not, is no snitch, bitch.

You got me hella fucked up. Anyways, get on the phone.
-[Princess] You're cute. -Get on the phone. I know I'm cute.
translation.es: - Eres linda. - Llama. Sé que soy linda.

Okay. All right.
The whole issue with Drea is she speaks on people.

translation.en: [Drea] One time.
Drea, she's just always running at the mouth.
It's like, either you run up or shut up.

Hey!
Hi, boo.
Some people aren't going to let it slide.

Drea!
Monster wants you.
Okay.

I never said nothing about you from jump.

I'm not gonna talk to you if that's how you speak to me.

Stop.

Stop.

With your ugly ass.
